title: Bug 6410: File appears unchanged but is marked as dirtied by code assist
description: When using code assist in a Java file, the file is marked as dirtied even though no changes have been made to the file.
OB: After performing code assist (CtrlSpace) in a Java file, the file is marked as dirtied, even though no changes have been made to the file.
EB: The file should not be marked as dirtied when code assist is performed without making any changes to the file.
SR:
To reproduce this issue:
1. Open a Java file.
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call.
3. For example, consider the cursor to be placed here: Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
4. Press CtrlSpace to trigger code assist.
5. Observe that the file is marked as dirtied even though no changes have been made to the file.
